oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter of final disposition and photographs of originial and permanent markers for Pvt. Charley Blair
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The mimeographed form letter informs Miss Louise Blair, Daylight, Tenn. of the burial location of Pvt. Charley Blair, Co. E, 125th Inf. Regt., 32nd Div. A separate slip provides a detailed location of the grave. Two photographs accompanying the letter show the temporary and permanent grave markers at Cemetery on the Heights of Romogne, Argonne, Meuse, France. Charley Blair was killed in action in the Argonne Offensive on October 9, 1918. His brother John was wounded three days earlier.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
